smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found. The PDF shows multiple populated diagrams, including use case diagrams (pages 2-3), an activity diagram (page 4), class/DB diagrams (pages 5-8, 10-13, 14-18), and a state diagram (page 9).

No explicit case was visible where a use case oval is clearly not associated with any actor. The use case diagrams list actors and use cases on pages 2 and 3, but the PDF text does not explicitly show missing associations, so no unambiguous violation can be confirmed. The function lists on the package/overview page 1 are not treated as ovals per the rule note.

No two or more use cases with names describing the same activity and associated with the same actor were clearly visible. The use case names on page 2 (e.g., 'Tuvasta kasutaja', 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid', 'Vaata kõiki autosid', 'Vaata autode koondaruannet') and page 3 (e.g., 'Registreeri auto', 'Lõpeta auto', 'Muuda autot', 'Aktiveeri auto', 'Unusta auto') appear distinct.

No package diagram with multiple model elements sharing the same primary element name in the same package was clearly visible. On the package-style overview on page 1, listed elements under registers and subsystems do not show obvious duplicates, and any tool-like metadata labels are excluded by the clarification.

No clear evidence was visible that two or more tables store redundant copies of the same data value without a foreign key connecting them. The database-style diagrams on pages 14-18 show many FK-related fields and connectors/annotations, and no unambiguous denormalized duplicate value storage is explicitly indicated.

Use case naming form appears consistent. The use case names on pages 2 and 3 largely begin with verbs in the same style (e.g., 'Tuvasta', 'Vaata', 'Registreeri', 'Lõpeta', 'Muuda', 'Aktiveeri', 'Unusta'), so no inconsistent form was clearly visible.

No state that cannot be reached was explicitly and unambiguously visible in the state diagram. The 'Auto seisundidiagramm' on page 9 shows multiple states (e.g., Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Lõpetatud, Unustatud) and a start node, but the PDF text does not clearly demonstrate an unreachable state.

No activity action that cannot be reached was explicitly visible. The activity diagram on page 4 shows a sequence of actions and decision points for ending a car, but no unambiguous unreachable action is indicated in the visible content.

No relationship in the class or database diagrams was clearly shown to lack multiplicity indicators at both ends. Class diagrams on pages 5-13 include visible multiplicities such as '0..1', '0..*', and '1'. The database diagrams on pages 14-18 appear to use standard FK-style connectors/annotations, which are exempt per the interpretation rules.

No single diagram was clearly shown to contain 10 or more central elements. The use case diagrams on pages 2 and 3 display fewer than 10 use cases each, the state diagram on page 9 shows fewer than 10 states, and the class/DB diagrams on pages 5-8, 10-13, and 14-18 appear to show fewer than 10 classes/tables per page based on the visible element lists. The overview/package page 1 is not counted as a central-element diagram per the note.

No class or table was unambiguously shown with 6 or more distinct visible relationship lines on a single diagram. While some tables (e.g., Auto-related tables on page 17) list multiple FK annotations, the rule requires counting distinct drawn relationship lines, and the PDF text does not clearly confirm 6+ separate visible lines.

The PDF content does not provide a clear, measurable indication that any two related elements are spaced more than twice the average distance between elements on a diagram. No explicit distance-based layout violation is unambiguously visible from the provided pages.

No use case oval or activity action name was clearly visible that fails to start with an active verb. Use cases on pages 2 and 3 begin with verbs. The activity diagram on page 4 includes decision-like phrases (e.g., question-form labels), but it is not unambiguous from the visible content that any non-verb phrase is an action node subject to this rule.

No class, table, attribute, or use case name of 3 or fewer characters was clearly visible. Examples of visible names such as 'Auto', 'Isik', 'Klient', 'Riik', and attributes like 'nimetus', 'parool', 'vin_kood' are longer than 3 characters.

No class name was clearly visible that starts with a lowercase letter or is plural. Class names across pages 5-13 (e.g., 'Isik', 'Töötaja', 'Auto', 'Klient', 'Klassifikaator') appear capitalized and singular.

No attribute/column name starting with an uppercase letter was clearly visible. Attribute and column names shown across class/DB diagrams (pages 6, 10-13, 14-18) appear to use lowercase with underscores (e.g., 'on_aktiivne', 'parool', 'isikukood', 'riik_kood').

No database table name was clearly visible that is plural. The tables shown in the database diagrams on pages 14-18 appear singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Kasutajakonto', 'Klient', 'Auto', 'Riik', 'Auto_mark'). Diagram titles referencing registers (e.g., 'Isikute register') do not by themselves indicate plural table names.

No class, table, attribute, or use case name was clearly visible with a type-indicating prefix or abbreviation such as 'tbl_', 'uc_', or 'str'. Allowed prefixes like 'PK_', 'FK_', 'pfK_', and 'IXFK_' appear in the database diagrams (pages 14-18) and are exempt.
